parameters.name: technician
parameters.description:
The username of the technician or authenticated user whose incidents are retrieved. The special
value "~" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

parameters.name: filterBy
parameters.description:
A JSON string of colon separated name and value pair used to filter incidents results, where the
value is comma separated. The default property is 'status' and default values 'open' and 'accepted'.

responseMessages.message: A required query parameter 'technician' was not specified for this request.

operations.description: A list of incident activities, both system and user generated

[
    {
        "id": "act-101",
        "firstName": "Ricky",
        "lastName": "Barker",
        "userId": "cus-101",
        "role": "Customer",
        "createdOn": "2015-07-18T09:00:41+00:00",
        "comment": "Fridge is utterly broken!",
        "picture": "data:image/png;base64,"
    },
    {
        "id": "act-102",
        "firstName": "Bob",
        "lastName": "Pronto",
        "userId": "tec-101",
        "role": "Field Service",
        "createdOn": "2015-07-19T13:00:00+00:00",
        "comment": "Status Changed to Accepted. Technician will respond within 48 hours.",
        "picture": "data:image/png;base64,"
    },
    {
        "id": "act-103",
        "firstName": "Bob",
        "lastName": "Pronto",
        "userId": "tec-101",
        "role": "Field Service",
        "createdOn": "2015-07-19T09:15:00+00:00",

        "picture": "data:image/png;base64,"
    }
]

operations.notes: Remove/reset the storage of all data.

responseMessages.message: The storage of all data item was deleted successfully.

apis.description: Analytics data that mashes 'incidents' and 'technician' information to provide meaningful views.

parameters.name: technician
parameters.description:
The technician username whose incident stats are retrieved. The special value "~" can be used to
indicate the authenticated user. 'technician' is also a dimension by which metrics are grouped by.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description:
The period for which stats is being requested. E.g. 'period' set to 'bimonthy' returns data
for the past 2 months using a default unit of date dimension of 'month'.

operations.notes:
Returns incidents metrics based on proximity to the technician location for the specified period.

This tells us how many incidents were assigned vs. fixed by a technician within a geographical radius
(dimension) from his current location, for the duration of period.

In the report, each row of data has a unique combination of dimension ('month' and 'technician') and metrics
('radius', 'incidentsFixed', 'incidentsAssigned').

parameters.name: technician
parameters.description:
The technician username whose incident stats are retrieved. The special value "~" can be used to
reference the authenticated user.

operations.notes: Returns incidents count for every priority.

responseMessages.message: A required query parameter 'Technician' was not specified for this request.

parameters.name: technician
parameters.description:
The technician username whose incident stats are retrieved. The special value "~" can be used to
indicate the authenticated user. 'technician' is also a dimension by which metrics are grouped by.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description:
The period for which stats is being requested. E.g. 'period' set to 'annual' returns data
for the past year using a default unit of date dimension of 'month'.

parameters.name: filterBy
parameters.description:
The colon separated property name and value to use, to filter incidents results. The default
property is 'status' and the value is 'closed'.

operations.notes: Returns performance metrics for logged in technician measured over a time period, compared to the average.

responseMessages.message: A required query parameter 'Technician' was not specified for this request.
